name: Dify
description: Dify is an open-source platform that enables developers and enterprises to build, deploy and manage AI applications with LLM-powered backend infrastructure, visual operation interface, and seamless integration with DeepSeek and other AI models.

content.overview: Dify is a comprehensive, production-ready platform that transforms how AI applications are created and managed. It serves as an integrated development environment (IDE) for LLM applications, enabling both technical and non-technical users to build sophisticated AI solutions through its intuitive visual interface and powerful backend infrastructure. Dify provides end-to-end capabilities spanning the entire application lifecycle, from prompt engineering and model configuration to deployment, monitoring, and continuous improvement. The platform excels at complex use cases including retrieval-augmented generation (RAG), AI agents, and multi-model orchestration, with robust features for knowledge management, conversation design, and enterprise-grade security. As an open-source solution with a vibrant community, Dify empowers users to create everything from simple chatbots to complex multi-agent systems while maintaining full control and customizability. The platform integrates seamlessly with various LLM providers including DeepSeek, OpenAI, Anthropic, and open-source models, making it an ideal foundation for building production AI applications that leverage the strengths of different models while abstracting away infrastructure complexity.

features.title: Visual AI Application Builder
features.description: Dify's visual application builder transforms the AI development process through an intuitive interface that enables rapid creation and iteration without coding. The builder provides purpose-specific templates for different application types including conversational assistants, text generation tools, and specialized agents with built-in best practices for each use case. Through the visual interface, users can define application behavior, conversation flows, and model parameters using natural language prompts combined with visual controls, enabling sophisticated prompt engineering without requiring technical expertise. The system includes real-time preview capabilities that allow immediate testing of changes, providing instant feedback during development. For complex applications, the builder supports modular design with reusable components, enabling consistent patterns across different applications. The interface includes collaborative features allowing teams to work together on application development with commenting, version control, and role-based access. Advanced features such as context window management, reasoning steps, and output format control are exposed through intuitive controls rather than complex configuration. This visual approach dramatically accelerates development time from days to hours while making AI development accessible to business analysts, subject matter experts, and other non-developers who understand their domain requirements but lack technical AI expertise.

features.title: Advanced Retrieval-Augmented Generation
features.description: Dify implements a sophisticated Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) system that enhances LLMs with external knowledge for greater accuracy and relevance. The platform provides complete knowledge management capabilities including document uploading, processing, and organization with support for diverse formats including PDFs, Word documents, Excel spreadsheets, PowerPoint presentations, HTML, Markdown, and plain text. Advanced document processing includes automatic segmentation with configurable chunking strategies, metadata extraction, and structure preservation to maintain document context. The integrated vector database system provides efficient semantic search with multiple embedding model options and customizable relevance metrics. Dify's RAG implementation includes context optimization techniques that intelligently select and prioritize the most relevant information to fit within model context windows, handling far more content than basic RAG approaches. The platform supports hybrid search combining semantic, keyword, and metadata filtering for precise information retrieval. For enterprise needs, Dify includes comprehensive knowledge base management with versioning, incremental updates, and scheduled synchronization with external sources. Query optimization automatically reformulates user questions to improve retrieval accuracy, while citation tracking provides source attribution and verification. This advanced RAG implementation enables applications to provide accurate, up-to-date responses grounded in organizational knowledge rather than relying solely on LLMs' pre-trained information, significantly reducing hallucinations and ensuring factual correctness for business-critical applications.

features.title: Multi-Model Orchestration and Evaluation
features.description: Dify provides sophisticated capabilities for working with multiple AI models in coordinated workflows, maximizing the strengths of different models while minimizing their individual limitations. The platform's model management system supports integration with a comprehensive range of model providers including DeepSeek, OpenAI, Anthropic, Google, and various open-source models, enabling flexible model selection based on capabilities, performance, and cost considerations. For complex applications, Dify implements advanced orchestration patterns allowing different models to handle specialized tasks within a single application flow, such as using high-capability models for complex reasoning and efficient models for simpler tasks. The platform includes built-in model evaluation frameworks that enable objective comparison of different models across parameters including accuracy, relevance, creativity, safety, and efficiency, with customizable evaluation criteria for specific use cases. A/B testing capabilities allow empirical evaluation of model performance with real user interactions, providing data-driven insights for model selection. Automatic fallback mechanisms ensure application resilience by redirecting requests to alternative models when primary models are unavailable or return errors. Cost optimization features intelligently route requests to the most economical model that meets quality requirements for each interaction type. This comprehensive multi-model approach enables organizations to create AI applications that leverage the best available models for each specific function while maintaining consistent user experiences and operational efficiency.

features.title: Enterprise-Grade AI Governance
features.description: Dify addresses the critical governance requirements for enterprise AI deployment with comprehensive controls for security, compliance, and operational management. The platform implements robust authentication and authorization systems with granular role-based access controls, enabling precise permission management for different user types across the organization. For data security, Dify provides encryption for data in transit and at rest, private deployment options, and comprehensive audit logging of all system activities and model interactions. The platform includes sophisticated monitoring capabilities that track application performance, usage patterns, and model metrics, with configurable alerts for anomalies or threshold violations. For regulatory compliance, Dify implements content filtering, PII detection and redaction, and configurable data retention policies aligned with privacy regulations. The governance framework includes detailed prompt and response logging with immutable records for auditing and compliance verification. Model management controls allow organizations to establish approved model lists with appropriate guardrails and usage policies for different application types and data sensitivity levels. Cost management features provide detailed usage tracking, budget controls, and optimization recommendations to maintain predictable AI operation expenses. For enterprise integration, the platform supports single sign-on, directory service synchronization, and enterprise security standards integration. These governance capabilities enable organizations to deploy AI applications with confidence, ensuring appropriate controls and visibility while allowing innovation and adoption across different business units.

features.title: Flexible API and Integration Framework
features.description: Dify provides a comprehensive development framework that enables seamless integration of AI capabilities into existing systems and workflows through multiple approaches. The platform generates production-ready APIs automatically for each application created through the visual builder, with RESTful endpoints that can be integrated into websites, mobile apps, or backend systems with minimal development effort. For web applications, Dify provides embeddable widgets and pre-built UI components that can be customized and integrated with simple JavaScript or iframe embedding. The platform includes client SDKs for major programming languages including Python, JavaScript, Java, and Go, making integration straightforward for developers across technology stacks. For complex enterprise scenarios, Dify supports webhook integration for event-driven architectures, allowing AI applications to interact with workflow systems, CRM platforms, and other enterprise software. The platform implements standard authentication methods including API keys, OAuth, and custom token authentication compatible with enterprise security requirements. Advanced API features include streaming responses for real-time interactions, batched processing for efficiency, and comprehensive error handling with detailed diagnostics. For developers requiring deeper customization, Dify exposes extension points for custom logic integration through serverless functions or API callbacks. The platform's API-first architecture ensures that any application built through the visual interface can also be accessed programmatically, providing flexibility to combine no-code development with custom integration where needed.

useCases.title: Enterprise Knowledge Management and Internal Assistance
useCases.description: Organizations deploy Dify to create comprehensive knowledge management solutions that transform how employees access and utilize institutional information. The implementation typically begins with connecting diverse knowledge sources including internal documentation, policy manuals, product specifications, training materials, and support databases into Dify's RAG system. Custom document processors are configured to handle organization-specific formats and extract structured metadata important for the business context. The platform's knowledge management capabilities maintain information freshness through scheduled synchronization with document management systems, ensuring that AI applications always access current information. Using the visual builder, teams create specialized assistance applications tailored to different departments and functions, such as HR policy advisors, technical support assistants, and product knowledge navigators. Each application is configured with appropriate access controls that reflect organizational information security policies, ensuring sensitive information is only accessible to authorized users. Integration with internal communication platforms like Slack, Microsoft Teams, or corporate intranets provides convenient access points for employees to interact with these knowledge applications. Usage analytics identify knowledge gaps and common queries, guiding documentation improvements and training initiatives. This enterprise knowledge approach dramatically improves information accessibility and utilization, reducing time spent searching for information while ensuring consistent and accurate responses based on authoritative internal sources.

useCases.title: Customer Support and Engagement Automation
useCases.description: Customer-facing businesses implement Dify to create sophisticated support and engagement applications that enhance customer experience while reducing operational costs. The implementation starts with developing conversational agents using Dify's visual builder, incorporating product knowledge, support procedures, and common customer scenarios. These applications leverage the platform's RAG capabilities to access comprehensive product documentation, troubleshooting guides, and policy information, ensuring accurate and consistent responses. Advanced conversation design creates natural interaction flows with appropriate escalation paths to human agents for complex issues, implemented through integration with existing customer service platforms. Multi-model orchestration enables cost-efficient operation by using lightweight models for initial triage and common queries while reserving more capable models for complex situations requiring nuanced understanding. For personalization, the applications connect to customer databases and interaction histories through Dify's API framework, allowing contextually appropriate responses based on customer profiles, purchase history, or previous interactions. Continuous improvement is facilitated through the platform's analytics and evaluation tools, which identify common customer issues, measure resolution rates, and highlight opportunities for knowledge base enhancement. This customer support approach creates a responsive, 24/7 support experience that handles routine inquiries automatically while intelligently routing complex issues to appropriate human specialists, improving customer satisfaction while optimizing support team efficiency.

useCases.title: AI-Enhanced Content Creation and Marketing
useCases.description: Marketing teams and content creators use Dify to develop specialized applications that enhance content production workflows and marketing campaign execution. The implementation begins with creating AI assistants for different content types and marketing functions, such as blog post creators, social media content generators, product description writers, and email campaign composers. Each application is configured with brand guidelines, tone specifications, and content strategy documents using Dify's knowledge management, ensuring all generated content remains consistent with brand identity and marketing objectives. For campaign-specific applications, marketing teams upload campaign briefs, target audience profiles, and competitive analysis documents as reference material, enabling contextually appropriate content generation. The multi-model capabilities allow specialized configurations for different content needsâ€”using creative models for brainstorming and conceptual work while employing more precise models for technical or compliance-sensitive content. Integration with existing marketing systems through Dify's API framework enables seamless workflows where content can be reviewed, refined, and published through familiar tools like content management systems and marketing automation platforms. The visual builder allows marketing teams to refine prompts and application behavior directly, reducing dependency on technical teams for adjustments. Analytics track content performance metrics correlated with generation parameters, enabling data-driven refinement of AI assistance strategies. This implementation transforms content creation processes, enabling marketing teams to produce greater content volume and variety while maintaining quality and brand consistency.

useCases.title: Business Process Analysis and Automation
useCases.description: Operations and business analysis teams implement Dify to create AI applications that help identify process optimization opportunities and automate routine business workflows. The implementation begins with developing specialized analysis applications that process operational data, process documentation, and performance metrics to identify inefficiencies, bottlenecks, and automation opportunities. These applications leverage Dify's RAG capabilities to incorporate business process documentation, standard operating procedures, and industry best practices as reference knowledge. For structured process automation, teams create AI agents that handle routine tasks including data extraction from unstructured documents, classification and routing of incoming information, and generation of standardized reports and communications. Integration with existing business systems through Dify's API framework enables these agents to interact with ERP systems, workflow management tools, and departmental applications, creating end-to-end process automation solutions. Complex processes benefit from multi-model orchestration, with specialized models handling different aspects of the workflow such as document understanding, decision-making, and response generation. Governance features ensure that automated processes operate within appropriate parameters with human oversight for exceptions and approvals. Analytics provide visibility into process performance, automation rates, and exception handling, guiding continuous improvement initiatives. This approach to business process enhancement creates a virtuous cycle where AI applications both identify optimization opportunities and implement the resulting automation, driving operational efficiency while freeing human staff to focus on higher-value activities requiring judgment and creativity.

faqs.question: How does Dify compare to direct API usage of language models?
faqs.answer: Dify provides several significant advantages over direct API usage of language models, addressing the complexity and limitations of raw API integration. First, Dify dramatically reduces development time through its visual application builder, allowing creation of AI applications in hours rather than the weeks typically required when working directly with APIs and building custom infrastructure. The platform handles complex technical aspects including context management, token optimization, response streaming, and error handling that would otherwise require extensive custom development. For knowledge-intensive applications, Dify's built-in RAG infrastructure eliminates the need to develop custom document processing, embedding generation, vector storage, and retrieval systems, which typically require substantial engineering resources when building directly on model APIs. The multi-model orchestration capabilities enable applications to leverage multiple AI providers without implementing complex switching logic, fallback mechanisms, and provider-specific adaptations. From an operational perspective, Dify provides comprehensive application monitoring, logging, and analytics that would require custom implementation with direct API usage. The platform's governance features including access controls, audit logging, and content filtering provide essential enterprise capabilities that are challenging to implement from scratch. Additionally, Dify's visual interface enables business stakeholders and subject matter experts to participate directly in application development and refinement, rather than requiring all changes to flow through technical teams. While direct API usage provides maximum flexibility for highly specialized applications, Dify offers a superior approach for most use cases by providing a complete application infrastructure that accelerates development, simplifies operations, and enables business-led innovation while still allowing custom code integration where needed.

faqs.question: What deployment options does Dify support?
faqs.answer: Dify supports flexible deployment options designed to accommodate diverse organizational requirements for security, compliance, and operational models. The platform can be deployed as a fully managed cloud service hosted by Dify.AI, providing the simplest operational experience with automatic updates, scaling, and infrastructure management. For organizations with specific security or compliance requirements, Dify offers private cloud deployment on customer-controlled cloud infrastructure in providers including AWS, Azure, Google Cloud, and other major cloud platforms, with dedicated resources and network isolation. For maximum control and data sovereignty, the platform supports on-premises deployment within corporate data centers or private clouds, with complete isolation from external networks if required. The open-source nature of Dify enables air-gapped deployment scenarios for high-security environments with no external network connectivity. For hybrid approaches, the platform can be configured with split deployment models where the application infrastructure runs within the organizational boundary while selectively using cloud services for specific functions like model inference. All self-hosted deployment options support containerization through Docker and Kubernetes for consistent operation and infrastructure-as-code automation. Enterprise deployments include integration with corporate authentication systems, SIEM tools, and monitoring infrastructure. The platform's modular architecture allows selective replacement of components like vector databases with existing enterprise services if desired. These flexible deployment options ensure that organizations can implement Dify in accordance with their specific security policies, compliance requirements, and existing infrastructure investments while maintaining full functionality.

faqs.question: How does Dify handle data privacy and security?
faqs.answer: Dify implements a comprehensive security and privacy framework designed for enterprise requirements and sensitive data handling. For data protection, the platform provides end-to-end encryption for all data in transit using TLS 1.3, with additional encryption for stored data including documents, conversations, and configuration details. The architecture implements strict data isolation ensuring that information from one application or tenant cannot be accessed by others. Dify's authentication system supports multiple methods including username/password with strong policies, SSO integration through SAML and OIDC, and multi-factor authentication for elevated security requirements. Authorization is managed through granular role-based access controls that can be aligned with organizational structures and security policies. For sensitive information handling, the platform includes PII detection and masking capabilities, preventing exposure of personal or confidential information in model inputs or logs. Comprehensive audit logging records all system activities including access events, configuration changes, and model interactions, providing traceability for security monitoring and compliance verification. The platform's open-source nature enables security review and validation by organizational security teams or third-party auditors. When using external model providers, Dify implements privacy-preserving techniques including query anonymization and minimizing data exposure. For regulated industries, the platform supports compliance with frameworks including GDPR, HIPAA, and SOC 2 through appropriate controls and documentation. These security and privacy capabilities ensure that organizations can deploy AI applications handling sensitive information with appropriate protections and governance.

faqs.question: How can I extend Dify's functionality for specialized requirements?
faqs.answer: Dify provides multiple extension mechanisms designed to accommodate specialized requirements while maintaining the benefits of the core platform. For custom application logic, Dify supports the integration of serverless functions or external microservices at defined extension points, allowing implementation of domain-specific processing, custom authentication flows, or specialized business rules. The platform's plugin system enables the development of packaged extensions that can be reused across applications, with both community-contributed and commercial plugins available for common requirements. For specialized document handling, Dify supports custom document processors that can be implemented to handle proprietary formats, extract domain-specific metadata, or apply specialized pre-processing for particular content types. The vector database abstraction layer allows integration of specialized vector stores for unique performance or functionality requirements beyond the built-in options. For custom user interfaces beyond the provided widgets, Dify's comprehensive API enables the development of tailored front-end experiences while leveraging the platform's backend capabilities. Organizations with unique model requirements can implement custom model connectors to integrate proprietary or specialized AI models not included in the standard provider catalog. The platform's open-source nature provides the ultimate extension capability, allowing direct modification of the codebase if needed for highly specialized scenarios. Dify maintains a well-documented architecture with clear interfaces between components, making it straightforward to identify appropriate extension points for specific requirements. The platform's active community provides a valuable resource for sharing extension approaches and best practices, with many common extensions available as open-source contributions.

faqs.question: What resources are required to run Dify effectively?
faqs.answer: Dify's resource requirements vary based on deployment scale, application complexity, and expected traffic patterns. For infrastructure, a basic production deployment typically requires at least 4 CPU cores, 16GB RAM, and 100GB storage for the application components, with additional resources for the vector database depending on knowledge base size. Containerized deployments benefit from Kubernetes clusters, though simpler deployments can use standalone servers or virtual machines. For cloud deployments, standard general-purpose instance types from major providers are usually sufficient, with the ability to scale horizontally for higher traffic loads. Database requirements include a PostgreSQL-compatible database for application data and a vector database for RAG functionality, with several supported options including Milvus, Qdrant, and PostgreSQL with vector extensions. Network requirements include outbound connectivity to model providers (unless using local models exclusively) and standard HTTP/HTTPS ports for application access. For development and operations skills, organizations typically benefit from having team members familiar with Docker and basic cloud infrastructure, though extensive DevOps expertise is not required for standard deployments. Non-technical users can effectively build and manage applications through the visual interface, while some technical support is beneficial for initial setup and integration. For high-availability productions deployments, standard redundancy practices for databases and application components are recommended. The platform includes built-in monitoring that can integrate with common observability tools to track resource utilization and performance. Dify's modular architecture allows selective scaling of components based on specific bottlenecks, enabling efficient resource utilization even for demanding enterprise deployments.
